com.mesosphere.sdk.config

Class TaskEnvRouter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.config.TaskEnvRouter

  • public class TaskEnvRouter
extends java.lang.Object
    Default implementation of a TaskEnvRouter which handles forwarding environment variables from two sources:
    • Scheduler's system environment: searches for environment variables that start with "TASKCFG_<TASKTYPE>_" and/or "TASKCFG_ALL_", and returns appropriate Maps for task types based on that environment.
    • Manually-provided values: The service developer may provide custom values which will then be forwarded to tasks as needed.

      Creates a new config router which uses the current system environment for its configuration.

      Creates a new config router which uses the provided environment variables, which should have TASKCFG_* prefixes.

    • Method Detail

      • setAllPodsEnv

        public TaskEnvRouter setAllPodsEnv(java.lang.String key,
                                   java.lang.String value)
        Adds a custom environment value to be included in all pods. This may be overridden by the Scheduler environment via TASKCFG_ALL_* or TASKCFG_<POD_TYPE>_* envvars, and by any per-pod types added via setPodEnv(String, String, String).

      • setPodEnv

        public TaskEnvRouter setPodEnv(java.lang.String podType,
                               java.lang.String key,
                               java.lang.String value)
        Adds a custom environment variable to be only included in the specified pod type. This may be overridden by the Scheduler environment via TASKCFG_ALL_* or TASKCFG_<POD_TYPE>_* envvars. This takes precedence over values specified via setAllPodsEnv(String, String) for pods with this type.

      • getConfig

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getConfig(java.lang.String podType)
        Returns the config to be injected into tasks with the provided podType.

        For example, given a task with type "index", this would match scheduler environment variables starting with "TASKCFG_ALL_" and "TASKCFG_INDEX_" (with those prefixes removed), as well as any appropriate envvars which were passed in via the Java API (with no modification). The prior takes priority over the latter.

        Parameters:
        podType - the pod type to be matched against
        Returns:
        any environment variables to include in tasks of type podType, or an empty map otherwise

        public java.lang.String toString()
